message:
A member of the Lebanese Forces (Christian) party, Richard Kouyoumjian mocks Nasrallah in a press interview:
Getting the residents of northern Israel to evacuate their homes has now become heroic?
If so, congratulations on the victory... (he is cynical - AA)

The Lebanese al-Mayadeen from a source in the "resistance" following yesterday's Israeli attack in Syria:

The reports according to which three Hezbollah members were killed in yesterday's Israeli attack on a truck in the Al Furqlus area of ​​Homs (Syria) are not true.
The truck driver jumped out of it, and was saved.
There were no Hezbollah members inside the truck.
Paris: French MPs Louis Boyard and Sebastien Delogu celebrate at an anti-Israel demonstration after being expelled from the parliament for waving the Palestinian flag.

The supreme leader of Iran in a direct appeal to students at US universities:

You are now on the right side of history.
You are part of the axis of resistance.
You started a legitimate fight against your brutal government that protects the "raping Zionist entity".
I recommend you to get to know the Quran.
The axis of resistance advances through it and with the help of Allah you will achieve victory.

##
Iran's supreme leader embraces the American students and includes them as part of the axis of resistance. Now they just need to convert to Islam and victory is at hand...
unbelievable.

Palestinian sources affiliated with the Palestinian Authority claim: the picture of the weapon shown yesterday👆 in the proclamation of the Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades in Tulkarm (which claimed to have infiltrated Bat Hefer-AA) is an old picture taken from the Internet.

The IDF spokesperson announced this morning the fall of three fighters:
Two in the ramming attack last night near Nablus and one in battle in the north of the Gaza Strip.

May their memories be a blessing.

Syria: Syrian opposition sources claim that the destruction of the residential building yesterday in Baniyas, and the killing of the Syrian girl, were caused by a Syrian interceptor missile that was launched at the Israeli warplanes that attacked in Syria yesterday evening.

American Senator: Saudi Arabia is not opposed to the destruction of Hamas

Republican Senator Lindsey Graham, visiting Israel, talks about the normalization agreement between Israel and Saudi Arabia and says out loud what Saudi Arabia cannot:

To reach an agreement, Saudi Arabia wants a reduction in the scope of the fighting. The Saudi Crown Prince does not expect Israel to agree to not destroying the Hamas battalions. No one in Saudi Arabia wants Hamas to remain a military presence (in order to reach an agreement - AA).
Why would Saudi Arabia invest money in the "new Palestine" if Hamas stays?
It is in everyone's interest to destroy these terrorist networks.

##
It should be remembered that Saudi Arabia is the leader of the Sunni axis and its position regarding Hamas is the position of many other Sunni countries - they cannot say publicly that they support the destruction of Hamas, but they would be happy for it to happen and as soon as possible.

Fatah's al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades in Tulkarm claim in a proclamation: Our operatives infiltrated a house in the settlement of Bat Hefer with the aim of eliminating an officer. The officer was not at home and only his children were present. In accordance with Islamic morality and contrary to the nature of the occupation's activities, the operatives spared the children and only took an M4 type weapon and a Glock pistol from the scene.

Syria - Lebanon

Residents of the Baaqa area in Lebanon (near the border with Syria) claim to have found fragments of an Israeli Spice 1000 missile in Lebanese territory, which they estimate was shot down by the Syrian air defense systems during the attack this evening.
